ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Color mixing theory and how to use acrylic paint
I explored ink and acrylic and learned about color interactions as well as how to paint from life.
I learned how to use acrylic paints, work on perspective and pursue independent projects
I learned how to experiment with different mediums and forms, and to explore things out of my comfort zone.
Really amazing Intro to painting
Improved my painting skill and found a personal style. Learned a lot about color theory as well as different practices/mediums to work with.
The basics of color theory and painting.
My basic painting skills were developed in the course.

color theory and the opportunity to grow more into an artist in terms of ideas and style -- the structure of this class was more experimental and about developing creativity and exploring your artistic visions which was refreshing because most intro classes focus on foundations

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: time to physically practice art-making and receive feedback from the instructor
Weaknesses: crits often only had positive comments, not constructive criticism

Halsey is incredibly passionate about art, and he wants you to feel good about your work and fall in love with creating art. Additionally, this class is 100% what you make of it. You could spend 1 hour or 10 hours on a painting, so passion for art and self-discipline is extremely important, but this freedom is also so wonderful. You'll create a lot of works through this class, and this is a great opportunity to explore new styles and forms.

I think its a really well structured course - every week we had something new to work on and we had crits every week or every other week. It was amazing and fostered a lot of friendships in the class.

Strengths: Great professor, excellent class dynamic

Weakness: Too little in class time for big projects.
Halsey is an amazing and understanding and flexible professor. Take any art class with him. No weaknesses.

Strengths: teacher was great, projects were always very diverse, still had creative freedom in class
Weakness: time constraints sometimes hard to meet

One strength of this course is the breadth of material that it teaches. One weakness of this course is the workload--there is a lack of standardized expectations for how much work we should be putting into each piece, and I often found myself staying up extremely late to finish projects, and then being sleep-deprived and late for class. Additionally, though we were promised that most of the class would be working on our art, what usually happened was we would spend all of class on critiques, and we were left to do all of our projects on our own time.
I think an assignment or two on figure painting (portraits, people, etc.) would have been fun and usefull, as that was not touched on in the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes

Definitely. If you miss painting, take this class! You'll feel like an artist again and maybe even find a new home at the art studio when you're there until midnight finishing your work. Also, different sections of this class use different materials (Halsey has students use ink and acrylic), but I wouldn't focus on that as long as you're aware of it. I had never used acrylic before but appreciated the opportunity to try out something new this semester.

I would absolutely recommend this course (specifically w Halsey Rodman) to other students. Painting is fun! I learned a lot more than I ever expected, while feeling supported by both my teacher/TA and my peers. Its a great, great class.
Yes, it was very fun and engaging, a great break for more serious Yale courses.
Absolutely. Art experience or not!
Definitely. Great way to break up schedule and teacher and projects were great.
I think it depends on whether or not you have the time to put as much energy into the work as it requires, but I did find that my painting improved.
Yes. Halsey was a great teacher and I felt engaged and challenged throughout the course.
YES IF YOU CAN GET INTO THIS CLASS TAKE IT ONE OF MY FAVORITE CLASSES AT YALE AND THIS SEMESTER AND HALSEY IS SO KIND AND ENCOURAGING
